name: Dishoom King's Cross
address: 5 Stable St, London N1C 4AB, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: Dishoom King’s Cross is one of the most beautiful and well-designed restaurants in London. The vintage Bombay theme, warm lighting, and detailed interiors create an unforgettable dining atmosphere. The food is consistent

name: Caravan King's Cross
address: 1 Granary Square, London N1C 4AA, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: I absolutely love the venue here. It’s a really lovely place to sit. We got a few bits to share, the spiced cauliflower which was lovely, the steamed cod dumplings (had too much lemongrass in the sauce for my liking) sti

name: Coal Office Restaurant
address: 2 Bagley Walk, London N1C 4PQ, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: Part of the impressive Coal Drop Yard development behind St Pancras station - the Coal Office cuisine is a mixed, Middle Eastern affair. Shades of Ottolenghi abound. The menu is divided between small bites, mid-sized and

name: FIRIN
address: 140 York Wy, London N1 0AX, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: Cosy, friendly Turkish restaurant on Yorkway near Granary Square in King's Cross. Friendly efficient service and very tasty kebap/stews and pide. Turkish wines as well which is a nice option for something different. Well

name: Granary Square Brasserie
address: 1 Granary Square, London N1C 4AA, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: The weekday set lunch is excellent; delicious and great value at £24 nett. I had the calamari to start and the grilled seabream as the main; both were beautifully prepared. The interior décor is impressive, making it a

name: The Lighterman
address: 3 Granary Square, London N1C 4BH, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: I was surprised how good the food was (I tried three appetisers, Mama Mia). Amazing food yet amazing view! Please choose the window seat. You will know what I am saying!

name: Spagnoletti
address: 27 Euston Rd., London NW1 2SD, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: The first time I went to the restaurant, I felt welcomed, the set up was great and the staff were really friendly. I tried the mushrooms mezzaluna with celeriac broth, loved it but the broth was a bit salty. The staff we

name: Granger & Co. King's Cross
address: Unit 1, The Stanley building, 7 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4AG, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: So easy to find, just near King’s Cross Station. We couldn’t book a table in the morning, only walk-ins. Excellent service. There’s both indoor and outdoor seating - since we wanted to sit inside, the staff gave us a ta

name: German Gymnasium
address: 1 King's Blvd, London N1C 4BU, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: German Gymnasium is worth visiting even just for its architecture. The building is beautiful and grand - impressive without feeling intimidating. We visited so as to try their Oktoberfest menu, and the experience was a b

name: Mildreds Kings Cross
address: 200 Pentonville Rd, London N1 9JP, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: Great place! Had the brunch burrito and my partner the green tofu salad both delicious. We shared a tiramisu for dessert. Definitely recommend! Service was super friendly and efficient too.

name: Tajmahal Indian cuisine
address: 339 Grays Inn Rd, London WC1X 8PX, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: A good Indian restaurant with exceptional service. The food wasn’t exceptionally good but definitely will do. We ordered a few dishes and the veg dishes weren’t great but reviews on the non veg (meat) dishes had a much b

name: Flat Iron Kings Cross
address: 47-51 Caledonian Rd, London N1 9BU, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: What an amazing experience. The staff is so friendly and they welcome you with some free popcorn and water with herbs. We have ordered their flat iron steak and it was amazing, the prices are also fare. I highly recommen

name: Fatto a Mano King's Cross
address: Unit 1, 3 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4AG, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: Absolutely loved this place! Just tried this Italian pizzeria for the first time and it was such a great experience. The pizza was so good — fresh, full of flavour, and perfectly cooked. The starter was amazing as well!

name: Nonos
address: 112 Judd St, London WC1H 9NT, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: Had an amazing time at “Nonos”. We couldn’t fault it for anything, and had an amazing evening. The food was absolutely delicious, with both the pork and chicken souvlaki being very tender and well spiced. We also got the

name: Morty & Bob's
address: 49, Coal Drops Yard, London N1C 4DQ, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: A brilliant spot in King’s Cross! Morty & Bob’s has such a great atmosphere relaxed, stylish, and perfectly tucked away inside Coal Drops Yard. We stopped by for lunch and everything was spot-on. The steak sandwich was j

name: Lina Stores Italian Restaurant & Deli King's Cross
address: 20 Stable St, London N1C 4DR, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: Nice menu with lots of options. Very friendly service and atmosphere is so cute. Pasta was tasty and well cooked and tasted fresh. The focaccia seemed like it was probably made the day before as the edges were dried out

name: Decimo
address: 10th Floor, 10 Argyle St, London WC1H 8EG, United Kingdom

name: Pizza Union King's Cross
address: 246-250 Pentonville Rd, London N1 9JY, United Kingdom
review_excerpt: Very nice place. Probably the cheapest pizza I ever had in a restaurant. No table service as such but nice service overall. Pizzas very tasty and fresh, thin (but not dry) and still a great deal for the price. Definitely

name: Kimchee Restaurant & Bar
address: Unit 4, 2 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4AG, United Kingdom

name: BAO Kings Cross
address: Unit 2, 4 Pancras Sq, London N1C 4DP, United Kingdom
